Migration

I recently migrated this static website from Pelican (with Python) to Hakyll (with Haskell). Blogging about one's ownconvoluted Hakyll setup seems almost like a rite of passage, so here's mine!

Contributing to Pandoc / Citeproc / Hakyll

What I learned:

  • I learned about the Uniplate package for generic data structure traversals. Apparently, list comprehensions support pattern matching!
  • I learned how to configure cabal to compile pandoc against my local copy of citeproc. I'm also using remote versions of both pandoc and hakyll, until the latest changes make it into a release. So, my Hakyll site can benefit immediately from the new changes :)
  • I read most of the CSL specification, which will be useful later when I add citations to my Noteworthy editor.
